job_details.degree_required: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

jd: Job Description -I will accept only TWO good profile on this position….Staff Data Engineer – Hybrid6+ Months (CTH)Video InterviewLocation – Hybrid: Hartford, CT or Charlotte, NC (3 days/week onsite)Need Locals only……..Need :Visa/DL Copies (Need Only Genuine Visas)Full Education with YearLinkedIn profile with Photo is Mandatory (Strong LinkedIn is needed at least 2 years old)Strong knowledge of Property & Casualty (P&C) Commercial Lines business (Candidates must be from Insurance Domain) Job Summary:We are seeking a Staff Data Engineer to join our Commercial Lines (CL) Data Modernization and Simplification Program. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop well-architected cloud-based data solutions to support various functions, including Business Intelligence, Actuarial, Data Science, Finance, and Operations.You will collaborate closely with technology colleagues, product owners, and product managers within the Agile Release Train to enhance the Commercial Lines Data assets for data and analytics consumers. A strong critical thinker with technical acumen is essential to identify root causes of business problems effectively. Top 3 Must-Have Hard Skills:Snowflake Cloud Data Platform:Experience with Snowflake utilities such as SnowSQL and Snowpipe (5+ years).Legacy Tech Stack:Strong knowledge of Oracle Database, PL/SQL, Autosys, Hadoop, stored procedures, and shell scripting (5+ years).DataOps Tools:Proficiency with tools like GitHub, Jenkins, and Udeploy (3+ years). Qualifications:Experience:5+ years in Data Engineering.2+ years of developing and operating production workloads in cloud infrastructure.Education:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field.Technical Skills:Hands-on experience with Snowflake, including utilities like SnowSQL and Snowpipe.Expert-level skills in AWS services, Snowflake, Python, and Spark (certifications are a plus).Expertise in ETL tools such as Talend and Informatica.Strong background in Data Warehousing: modeling, mapping, building batch and real-time data pipelines.Familiarity with Agile tools like Rally.Industry Knowledge:Strong knowledge of Property & Casualty (P&C) Commercial Lines business.Communication Skills:Excellent written and verbal communication skills to interact effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
